subject: Home & DIY
title: Victorian Houses and Hidden Plumbing
description: A quick, practical guide to Victorian Houses and Hidden Plumbing.

hook.text: Victorian homes look elegant outside. Inside, they pioneered something revolutionary: indoor plumbing on every floor.

buildup.text: Before the 1850s, even wealthy homes used outdoor privies. Cholera epidemics forced cities to demand better sanitation.

discovery.text: The S-trap pipe, invented by Alexander Cumming, used water as a gas seal to block sewer fumes from entering homes.

twist.text: Early lead pipes poisoned residents slowly. The word 'plumbing' literally comes from 'plumbum,' Latin for lead.

climax.text: Building codes mandating proper drainage transformed houses from disease traps into safe domestic spaces.

punchline.text: Clean homes started with a curved pipe.

quiz.question: How does an S-trap pipe prevent sewer gases from entering a home?
options: Water sitting in the curve acts as a gas seal
A mechanical valve opens and closes automatically
